election_record.label: Vermont 1814 Governor

overview.note: Since no candidate received a majority as required by Vermont law, the election passed to the State Legislature, which chose Martin Chittenden.

The Northern Sentinel (Burlington, VT), October 21, North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, and The Bennington Newsletter, October 24, report totals of 17,466 votes for Martin Chittenden, 17,411 votes for Jonas Galusha and 451 scattering votes.
The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports totals of 17,466 votes for Martin Chittenden and 17,414 votes for Jonas Galusha in 1814.
The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815: "Last year Chittenden had 56 more votes than Galusha."
The Washingtonian (Windsor, VT), September 12: "From present appearances, we are induced to believe there will be no choice of Governor, or Lieut. Governor, by the people."

The Vermont Mirror (Middlebury, VT), October 19: "ELECTION. The Legislature of this State commenced its session in Montpelier on Thursday last. The usual business was transacted, when a committee of Canvassers was appointed, consisting of three members from each county, who immediately retired to perform the duties assigned them. After sorting and counting the votes for Governour, it appeared that His Ex'y MARTIN CHITTENDEN had 17,466--JONAS GALUSHA, Esq. 17,411--scattering, 451; of course, no choice by the people. [Bur. Gaz.]"

North Star (Danville, VT), October 22: "Extract of a letter from a member of the Legislature, to the Editor of the Star, dated 'Montpelier, October 14, 1814. Inclosed you will receive the statement of votes for State Officers. We have had a fair and honorable canvass, by which it appears that there is no choice of Governor or Lieut. Governor by the freemen.'"

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, 1814, and The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports a total of 1817 for Martin Chittenden in Addison County.

sub_unit.name: Middlebury
sub_unit.note: The Green-Mountain Farmer (Bennington, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 138 votes for Jonas Galusha in Middlebury.
North Star (Danville, VT), September 16, 1815, reports 281 votes for Martin Chittenden in Middlebury.

sub_unit.name: New Haven
sub_unit.note: The Green-Mountain Farmer (Bennington, VT), September 18, 1815, reports a majority of 29 votes for Martin Chittenden in New Haven.

sub_unit.name: Vergennes
sub_unit.note: These votes are listed as being for Vergennes and Waltham.

sub_unit.name: Whiting
sub_unit.note: The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), September 13, 1815, The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, and North Star (Danville, VT), September 30, 1815, report 22 votes for Martin Chittenden in Whiting.

sub_unit.name: Bennington
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 213 votes for Jonas Galusha in Bennington.

sub_unit.name: Readsboro
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 23, 1815, reports 19 votes for Jonas Galusha in Readsboro.

sub_unit.name: Burlington
sub_unit.note: The Burlington Town Records reports 284 votes for Martin Chittenden.

sub_unit.name: Hinesburgh
sub_unit.note: The Green-Mountain Farmer (Bennington, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 157 votes for Martin Chittenden in Hinesburgh.

sub_unit.name: Huntington
sub_unit.note: The National Standard (Middlebury, VT), September 13, 1815, reports 68 votes for Jonas Galusha in Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Brunswick
sub_unit.note: The Brunswick Town Records records 18 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Westmore
sub_unit.note: There was no return from Westmore.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, 1814, and The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports totals of 1391 for Martin Chittenden and 790 for Jonas Galusha in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Berkshire
sub_unit.note: The Green-Mountain Farmer (Bennington, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 25 votes for Jonas Galusha in Berkshire.

sub_unit.name: Georgia
sub_unit.note: The votes from Georgia were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Johnson
sub_unit.note: The Johnson Town Records records 67 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Saint Albans
sub_unit.note: The Johnson Town Records records 169 votes for Martin Chittenden.

sub_unit.name: Sheldon
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Mirror (Middlebury, VT), September 13, 1815, reports 97 votes for Martin Chittenden in Sheldon.

sub_unit.name: Grand Isle
sub_unit.note: The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), September 12, 1815, reports 42 votes for Jonas Galusha in Grand Isle.

sub_unit.name: Worcester
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Mirror (Middlebury, VT), September 13, 1815, reports 16 votes for Jonas Galusha in Worcester.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports a total of 1475 for Martin Chittenden in Orange County in 1814.

sub_unit.name: Bradford
sub_unit.note: The Bradford Town Records records 66 votes for Martin Chittenden.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Green-Mountain Farmer (Bennington, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 53 votes for Martin Chittenden in Orange.

sub_unit.name: Tunbridge
sub_unit.note: The Tunbridge Town Records records 87 votes for Martin Chittenden and 147 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Orleans
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, 1814, and The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports totals of 569 for Martin Chittenden and 427 for Jonas Galusha in Orleans County.

sub_unit.name: Kellyvale
sub_unit.note: The Kellyvale Town Records records 17 votes for Martin Chittenden.

sub_unit.name: Morristown
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 38 votes for Martin Chittenden in Morristown.

sub_unit.name: Navy
sub_unit.note: The votes from Navy were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Troy
sub_unit.note: Troy Town Records: "26 at freemans meeting."

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Jonas Galusha with 2596 votes but the town totals add up to 2601.
North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, 1814, and The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports totals of 1921 for Martin Chittenden and 2573 for Jonas Galusha in Rutland County.

sub_unit.name: Danby
sub_unit.note: The broadsheet "Votes for Governor, In the State of Vermont, as counted by the Canvassing Committees" reports 25 votes for Martin Chittenden in Danby.

sub_unit.name: Fairhaven
sub_unit.note: On the broadsheet "Votes for Governor, In the State of Vermont, as counted by the Canvassing Committees" these votes are listed as being for Fairhaven and Westhaven.

sub_unit.name: Philadelphia
sub_unit.note: The votes from Philadelphia were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Pittsfield
sub_unit.note: The Pittsfield Town Records records 18 votes for Martin Chittenden.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, 1814, and The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, reports a total of 2964 for Martin Chittenden in Windham County.

sub_unit.name: Brattleboro
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 26 votes for Jonas Galusha in Brattleboro.

sub_unit.name: Dummerston
sub_unit.note: The Dummerston Town Records records 55 votes for Jonas Galusha.

sub_unit.name: Grafton
sub_unit.note: North Star (Danville, VT), September 23, 1815, reports 182 votes for Martin Chittenden in Grafton.

sub_unit.name: Wardsboro
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, and North Star (Danville, VT), September 23, 1815, report 143 votes for Martin Chittenden in Wardsboro.

sub_unit.name: Wilmington
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 27 votes for Jonas Galusha in Wilmington.

sub_unit.name: Windham
sub_unit.note: The Vermont Republican (Windsor, VT), September 18, 1815, reports 39 votes for Martin Chittenden in Windham.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Official Results, North Star (Danville, VT), October 22, 1814, and The Watchman (Montpelier, VT), October 17, 1815, report 3473 votes for Jonas Galusha in Windsor County; however, the sum of totals per town is 3476.

sub_unit.name: Baltimore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Baltimore.

sub_unit.name: Bethel
sub_unit.note: The Bethel Town Records reports 42 votes for Martin Chittenden.

sub_unit.name: Sharon
sub_unit.note: The Sharon Town Records reports 95 votes for Jonas Galusha.

election_record.reference: Votes for Governor, In the State of Vermont, as counted by the Canvassing Committees. In the years 1814 and 1815. Office of the Governor. Walton and Goss, Printers. Montpelier, VT.
Political and Commercial Register (Philadelphia, PA). October 21, 1814.
Phelps, James Houghton. Collections Relating to the History and Inhabitants of the Town of Townshend, Vermont. Townshend, VT: G.E. Selleck, 1877. 229.
